conclusion: Object A is lifted the same vertical distance h = 0.60 m when spring C is pulled from position a to b.
At the final position, the upward elastic force supplied by spring B equals A’s weight.
Calculate x using k₁ x = mg, resulting in x = 0.098 m.
Spring B has been compressed 0.098 m from its natural length.
The rope is inextensible and the system is moved quasistatically.
The tension in the rope equals the tension in spring C, which also equals the weight mg.
Calculate k₂ using k₂ Δl = mg, resulting in k₂ ≈ 32.7 N m⁻¹.
Vertical rise of block A: h = 0.60 m.
Spring constant of spring C: k₂ ≈ 3.3 × 10¹ N m⁻¹.
